sen.j: 十河 千松丸（そごう せんまつまる、天正3年（1575年） - 天正17年（1589年）7月）は、十河存保の子。
sen.e: Senmatsumaru SOGO (1575 - August 11, 1589) was a son of Masayasu SOGO.

sen.j: 天正14年（1587年）、戸次川の戦いに参戦していた父の存保は「まだ千松丸は豊臣秀吉に謁見してない。自分が亡くなったら必ず秀吉に謁見させ、十河家を存続させるように」と家臣に伝えて、壮絶な戦死を遂げた。
sen.e: In 1587, Masayasu SOGO met a heroic end in the battle of Hetsugigawa, leaving the word to his vessel 'Senmatsumaru has not have an audience with Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI yet. Be sure to have him have an audience with Hideyoshi after my death, to succeed me and carry on the name of the SOGO family.'

sen.j: 存保の戦死により2万石の領地は没収され、その後同地に入った生駒親正は鼻紙代と称し3000石のみ与え、千松丸は親正の元で養育された。
sen.e: After the death of Masayasu, however, his fief of 20,000 koku (1 koku weighs about 150 kg of rice) was confiscated, and Chikamasa IKOMA who was granted the fief brought up Senmatsumaru in his residence, allowing Senmatsumaru merely 3,000 koku for small expenses.

sen.j: 成長後、豊臣秀吉との謁見の席が設けられたが、そこには親正とその甥の大塚釆女が同席していた。
sen.e: When Senmatsumaru grew up, it was arranged to have him have an audience with Hideyoshi, but accompanied by Chikamasa IKOMA and Chikamasa's nephew Uneme OTSUKA.

sen.j: 秀吉は、千松丸の器量は父親に劣らず早く大人になって立派な武将になるようにと言って喜び、3000石しか領地を与えていないことには不服であったといわれる。
sen.e: Hideyoshi was pleased to meet Senmatsumaru and said that Senmatsumaru appeared to be as capable as Masayasu and that he expected Senmatsumaru to grow up to be a brave warlord, but displeased at such treatment for Senmatsumaru as having gave him merely 3,000 koku.

sen.j: 帰国後、千松丸はまもなく病没。
sen.e: Immediately after returning home, Senmatsumaru died of illness.

sen.j: 突然の死は生駒氏により毒殺されたと噂された。
sen.e: It was rumored that his sudden death might have been a poisoning murder by the Ikoma clan.

sen.j: 遺臣や領民たちは嘆き悲しみ「命すつるも子ゆえにすたれ けなげなれとよ 千松丸」と唄い、十河父子の菩提を弔ったという。
sen.e: The left Senmatsumaru's retainers and people lived in his fief mourned over his death and held a memorial service for Senmatsumaru and his father with a song 'Father risked his life for the sake of his son Senmatsumaru--"Be a brave man, my son".'
